post: We are excited to announce the generous donation of "We the People" and "The First Amendment" from The Printing Industry of the Carolinas (PICA). These works honor the legacy of print in shaping our democracy and coincide with our Power of the Printed Word campaign. PICA generously helped to distribute thousands of pocket constitutions to students across North and South Carolina. Their continued support ensures students have access to the Constitution. To learn more about PICA, visit  https://picanet.org/

Need a gift for the holidays? BRI is excited to announce our newest affiliate partnership with History By Mail. History By Mail is a monthly subscription service for reproductions of historical letters and documents. Each replica comes with a separate document explaining the context of the letter, including its author, recipient, and relevance to the events of its time, as well as a transcription when necessary. Use code 'BRI' to receive a discount at checkout, and a portion of your purchase supports BRI helping us provide free civics and history education to classrooms nationwide. . At the Bill of Rights Institute, we believe all students deserve access to high-quality civic education. Thats why BRI offers free classroom resources and continually works to expand access for students of all backgrounds. Our Civics for Everyone initiative is made possible by a coalition of partnerstech leaders, corporations, foundations, educational groups, and disability advocateswho share our commitment to helping students learn about our nation, government, and their civic responsibilities. Yesterday was Bill of Rights Day- the 233rd anniversary of the ratification of the Bill of Rights. On December 15, 1791, rights we hold dear as Americans – like freedom of speech, due process, and the freedom to practice the faith of our choice – became law in our nation. BRI President and CEO David Bobb joined Washington Journal to discuss the story of the Bill of Rights and the importance of teaching young people about the significance of our Founding documents and principles in their everyday lives. Watch the full interview here:  https://lnkd.in/dfWJjJag  #BillofRights  #BillofRightsInstitute
